alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:24PM EST until February 18 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding as recent rain and snowmelt result in rising water level on the St. Clair River. In addition, an increasing northerly wind will maintain strong flow from lake Huron and bring the potential for an ice blockage to develop. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until noon EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM EST, river gauge readings indicate river levels continue to rise. Potential for minor flooding will be possible through Friday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Clair, East China Township, Algonac, Marine City and Pearl Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
